misuses.misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation
misuses.description: The code uses the "IDEA" algorithm, which is a less secure algorithm compared to AES. This could be due to a misconfiguration or a lack of understanding of the security implications of the algorithm.
misuses.recommendation: Use a more secure algorithm such as AES with a sufficient key length and proper key management.

misuses.description: The code uses the "AES" algorithm with a default key length of 128 bits, which may not be sufficient for all use cases. It is recommended to use a key length of at least 256 bits for most applications.
misuses.recommendation: Increase the key length to 256 bits or higher to ensure adequate encryption strength.

misuses.description: The code hardcodes the value of the "choice" variable, which could be used to store sensitive information such as encryption keys or credentials.
misuses.recommendation: Remove the hardcoded value and use a more secure method for storing and managing sensitive information.
